meanings.definition: A narrow point of land extending into a body of water, composed of sand.
meanings.sent1: The sandspit jutted out into the ocean, creating a small beach area.
meanings.sent2: We walked along the sandy sandspit, enjoying the view of the water on both sides.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls gathered on the sandspit, holding a beach party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The sandspit was like a finger reaching into the sea, inviting us to explore.
meanings.sent5: The sandspit shimmered in the sunlight, a beautiful natural formation.

meanings.definition: To form or cause to form a sandspit.
meanings.sent1: The strong currents can sandspit the shoreline, creating new landforms.
meanings.sent2: If we keep dumping sand here, we will sandspit the area and change the coastline.
meanings.sent3: The children's sandcastle competition accidentally sandspit the beach, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The river's flow can sandspit the sediment, shaping the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: The construction of the dam may sandspit the river, altering its natural course.
